name: places/ChIJKX8TWQ_2wokRowRRIMohqqQ
formattedAddress: 106 E 116th St #5, New York, NY 10029, USA
adrFormatAddress: 106 E 116th St #5, New York, NY 10029-1328, USA

originalText.text:
Barbershop full of extremely average barbers with the arrogance of seasoned proâ€™s. Just moved to East Harlem so was looking for a shop and a friend said they were okay so I decided to go to them since they are close. The first two times I got aggressively average haircuts, but the price was decent and it was convenient so decided to go back a third time. Mind you, the second time, I had to wait 5 minutes to get in the chair, which of course is not a big deal at all. However the third time I went (which was today) I walked in the shop at 2:01 and was told I would not be serviced because I was a minute late for my appointment at 2.

Iâ€™m not sure if these people are stupid and just donâ€™t understand the reason that many successful businesses have a grace period or they just donâ€™t like money, but at any rate itâ€™s weird, especially given that I have waited in that barbershop before. Arrogant set of very average barbers, who are not worth the hassle. Iâ€™m sure theyâ€™ll reply with the same garbage theyâ€™ve been peddling under other peopleâ€™s comments who call out this ridiculous behavior, not realizing that itâ€™s costing them revenue.

originalText.text:
I have never written a review before but this incident has me disheartened by the way customers are treated. I have been coming to this barbershop for 2 years after I walked in and was told that they book through an app. I moved to Harlem but never had a barber here because I went to my childhood barber in the Bronx. I saw recently that I was blocked on the app due to three cancellations ( which I never knew was policy) over the span of 2 years, I guess customer loyalty is not valued and they have so much business they don't feel the need to build relationships with the people they service. the reason I needed to cancel for my last appointment was I had a last minute meeting, I usually get my cut on my lunch break because I work from home. Side note: The short one with the glasses is rude as hell and treats customers very harshly. I was 3 minutes late ( because of traffic) and my barber was on vacation and he tried to cancel my appointment.
READ CAREFULLY!  The response to my review does not invalidate what was written.

originalText.text:
The BEST OF THE BEST!! Real simple.. book your appointment.. show up on timeâ€¦ and you wonâ€™t be disappointed. Started going to Randyâ€™s barber shop about a year and I havenâ€™t gone else where since. They treat you like family and no matter the barber youâ€™ll get an amazing haircut. Prices are also reasonable and not inflated like other uptown barber shops.

Randy is my barber and he takes his time to make sure he gets the haircut just like you want it.

Love the Booksy coordination since it makes everything simple and their is no wait time Beyond 5minutes.

5 stars all around!!

originalText.text: Really didn't want to go there... I have my own barber... 2 actually, but in the same shop. That way i can be next faster. My barbers were both on vacation and i needed a cut badly. I had an appointment where i had to look presentable. I went to this shop and I'm not going to lie, i was a lil worried plus while getting my cut, BUT I must say... The guy that cut my hair did a very good job. I left happy and relieved, lol. The price is also good. I know have an emergency spot.
